Larry and Sergey are 10 years older than they were when they thoughtfully hired Eric Schmidt to be the CEO... so everybody's growing up, Vint Cerf said. Google has grown over the past decade from a start-up battling other Internet search engines into a technology giant with nearly 25,000 employees and annual revenue of nearly$ 30 billion.

Industry Minister Maurizio Sacconi hailed the victory. The outcome of the referendum opens an evolution in industrial relations, especially in large factories that should allow a better use of the plants and a real increase in salaries, Maurizio Sacconi told Italian state radio. Sergio Marchionne had pledged to link pay increases to productivity. But the flexible work rules also limit the right to strike during full production, and reduce break times and sick pay

from seventeen U.S. Senators and initiated by Kirsten Gillibrand ( D-NY), claims the resolution "hurts the prospects for a peace agreement and is not in the interest of the United States" and "strongly" urges Hillary Clinton to make clear that the United States will veto such a resolution if it is raised at the Council, and to clearly communicate the United States' intent to do so to other Security Council members. Undoubtedly drafted by AIPAC and passed along to the most die-hard Zionist apologists in Congress, the letter is so fraught with inaccuracies and misstatements that even JTA's Ron Kampeas was forced to admit that it makes no sense.

Despite his support for Barack Obama , Colin Powell would make no commitment yet for the 2012 White House race. "I will always vote for the person who I think is best qualified," he said. I am not committed to any candidate until I see all the candidates. I have not yet seen anybody on the Republican side that I am ready to commit to and I am not committed to Barack Obama either.
